class bosk.block.zoo.gpu_blocks.BaseBlock#

Bases: abc.ABC

Base block, the parent of every computation block.

Block has meta information, that defines the inputs and outputs as well as block execution properties, and slots which are unique for each block instance and can be used to connect different block between each other.

Main block methods are: fit(…) and transform(…). Both accept dictionaries as input, transform(…) returns a dictionary with output data.

meta#

Meta information of the block. May be shaped between different blocks. If the meta information cannot be specified at the class definition step, DynamicBlockMetaStub should be used as a stub, and then redefined at the initialization step.

Return type:

bosk.block.meta.BlockMeta

slots#

Block slots of type BlockSlots, made dynamically at the initialization. Slots are unique for the block instance.

abstract property meta: bosk.block.meta.BlockMeta#

Meta information property getter.

Children classes must specify meta. It can be implemented as an attribute without redefining a property, for example:

class StubBlock(BaseBlock):
    meta = BlockMeta(...)
Return type:

bosk.block.meta.BlockMeta

property default_output: Optional[str]#

Get default output name.

If the block has a single output, it will be used as a default. Otherwise, the block can override this property to set a specific default output. If the block can’t have a single default output (its outputs have equal importance), this method should return None.

Return type:

Optional[str]

_make_slots()#

Make slots

abstract fit(inputs)#

Fit the block on the given input data.

Parameters:

inputs (BlockInputData) – Block input data for the fitting stage.

Returns:

Self.

Return type:

BlockT

abstract transform(inputs)#

Transform the given input data, i.e. compute values for each output slot.

Parameters:

inputs (BlockInputData) – Block input data for the transforming stage.

Returns:

Outputs calculated for the given inputs.

Return type:

TransformOutputData

wrap(output_values)#

Wrap outputs dictionary into BlockOutputs object.

Parameters:

output_values (Mapping[str, bosk.data.BaseData]) – Dictionary of values indexed by slot names.

Returns:

Block outputs object indexed by slots.

Return type:

BlockOutputData

bosk.block.zoo.gpu_blocks.TransformOutputData#

Block transform output values container data type.

It is indexed by output slot names.

bosk.block.zoo.gpu_blocks.BlockInputData#

Block input values container data type.

It is indexed by input slot names.

bosk.block.zoo.gpu_blocks.make_simple_meta(input_names, output_names, **additional_params)#

Make simple block meta from input and output slot names.

Parameters:

  • input_names (List[str]) – List of input slot names.

  • output_names (List[str]) – List of output slot names.

  • **additional_params – Additional meta params.

Returns:

Block meta with given inputs and outputs.

Return type:

BlockMeta

class bosk.block.zoo.gpu_blocks.BlockExecutionProperties#

Block execution properties.

cpu :bool = True#

Has CPU implementation that handles CPU data.

gpu :bool = False#

Has GPU implementation that handles GPU data.

threadsafe :bool = False#

CPU/GPU implementation is thread safe, can be executed in parallel.

plain :bool = False#

Block implementation is straightforward and not computantionally expensive, it should not be parallelized (parallelization costs are larger than computation).

class bosk.block.zoo.gpu_blocks.CPUData(data)#

Bases: BaseData

CPU-based representation of data.

Parameters:

data (Union[numpy.ndarray, jax.numpy.ndarray]) –

class bosk.block.zoo.gpu_blocks.MoveToBlock(to=None)#

Bases: bosk.block.base.BaseBlock

Move-to block.

Moves the input data to the specified device.

Parameters:

to (Union[str, None]) – Device to move to.

Input slots#

Fit inputs#

The fit step is bypassed.

Transform inputs#

  • X: Feature data array.

Output slots#

  • X: The same array on the specified device.

meta#
fit(inputs)#

The block bypasses the fit step.

Parameters:

inputs (bosk.block.base.BlockInputData) –

Return type:

MoveToBlock

transform(inputs)#

Transform the given input data, i.e. compute values for each output slot.

Parameters:

inputs (bosk.block.base.BlockInputData) – Block input data for the transforming stage.

Returns:

Outputs calculated for the given inputs.

Return type:

bosk.block.base.TransformOutputData
